Articles.Content: Recently my screenshots won't save I think it has to do either with me moving KSP from my windows programs folder to my desktop because I couldn't save my edit to the persistent file while in programs and craft files of ships I build aren't easily found when there either. I checked my settings and F1 is still mapped to screenshot and a copy of my whole KSP folder is on a flash drive I take to my college (the computers there can run the game at all max settings and dock high part counts without a drop of lag! ) but anyways screenshots work on the flash drive at school, but not on my laptop at home anybody know a solution?

Hi,

One solution is to set up a junction. KSP will think that your persistent file is in the normal directory tree, but you can edit it in its' actual location (which could be in My Documents, for example). I've done the same with my save files. Because this gets synced to SkyDrive, I have instant Cloud synchronisation with my KSP saves

Cheers,

Adam

One solution is to set up a junction. KSP will think that your persistent file is in the normal directory tree, but you can edit it in its' actual location (which could be in My Documents, for example). I've done the same with my save files. Because this gets synced to SkyDrive, I have instant Cloud synchronisation with my KSP saves

Been thinking of doing this with my VAB folders and Subassemblies, so I can share crafts across saves without having to manually drag the files around.
Try to compress the whole KSP folder (e.g. using 7zip), delete it from the disk, and uncompress it again. That should assign all files correct permissions.

Sounds like you moved the .exe file out of the origin map and to another one? Try leaving the .exe in the map and making a copy to desktop instead, maybe that works?

Just taking shots in the dark here, I have no idea if that would work
Alright im sending Jeb out to work on this. ps RIP to the 3 kerbals that just died in a terrible space station accident
